title: 1926 New Zealand rugby union tour of New South Wales
text:
The 1926 New Zealand tour rugby to New South Wales was the 13th tour by the <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">New Zealand</a> national <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> team to Australia.
During the First World War the activity of Rugby Union was suspended. In Australia, the sport was initially reprised only in New South Wales (many players switched to <a href="Rugby%20league">Rugby league</a> especially in <a href="Queensland">Queensland</a>), so official test matches between the two national sides were not resumed until 1929.
The four most important matches were played against the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Waratahs">New South Wales selection</a>, and New Zealand won the 4 match series 3–1. In 1986 the <a href="Australian%20Rugby%20Union">Australian Rugby Union</a> accorded Test status to the New South Wales matches played against international teams in the 1920–1928 period, but the matches against the All Blacks are not recorded as Tests by the <a href="New%20Zealand%20Rugby%20Union">New Zealand Rugby Union</a>.
The matches.

"Scores and results list New Zealand's points tally first."

"Scores and results list New Zealand's points tally first."
